author: animegamingdude

text:
@SupraDarky 4 isn't necessarily bad but essentially compared to the others, the later 3 aren't at the same scale as the first 3. The latter 3 focus on special gimmicks, tournaments for 4, liberation missions for 5, beast mode for 6. I personally wasn't as fond of 6 though due to getting rid of most aspects from the first 5(locations and people I mean, not the gameplay for that it went back to basics).
However I still retain none of them were bad. 3 holds a special place in my heart however.
author: Arc13

text:
All MegaMan X games were awesome except for 6 and 7, in my opinion.
I'd even say the X series is overall better than the regular series, but once again, that's just my opinion, so don't come down trolling on me.

text:
FAQ: What on earth is a Mijinion?

Answer: The name Mijinion is derived from the Japanese word "mijinko" (ミジンコ), which means daphnia or water flea.

author: SupraDarky

text:
My first Megaman was Megaman X (I asked my mom to find me Megaman 7, but she found X instead). I was disappointed at first before I played it (I was a clueless little kid), but it was awesome after I tried it.

I've played X4 and X7 before, the Battle Network series (2, 3, 4 only) on GBA, and the BN one on Gamecube. I think I've played some of the early ones on the gameboy too.

text:
Too bad the game was pretty crappy >_>

There are a good bunch of music from MMX that could be thrown in there. The whole MMX OST, notably Spark Mandrill, Storm Eagle, second Sigma stage and maybe the intro stage. Also X vs Zero from X5, and Dynamo from X5 too. I don't know what are your plans, but this list wouldn't be complete without them :p
